entry.title: Quinn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Quinn (pictured) became the first out, transgender, non-binary athlete to medal at the Summer Olympic Games when they won gold with the Canada national soccer team?

entry.title: Giedrė Šlekytė (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Giedrė Šlekytė conducted a version of Mozart's Die Zauberflöte for children at the 2018 Salzburg Festival, and Poulenc's Dialogues des Carmélites at the Oper Frankfurt in 2021?

entry.title: your attention can be stolen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that your attention can be stolen?

entry.title: Eli Bebout (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eli Bebout, a future Speaker of the Wyoming House of Representatives, was first elected as a write-in candidate?

entry.title: Go, Jimmy, Go (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1959 song "Go, Jimmy, Go" by Jimmy Clanton was originally offered to Bobby Rydell with the title "Go, Bobby, Go"?

entry.title: Max Vernon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that police negotiator Max Vernon told the actor portraying him in 6 Days that "you've been wrongly cast. You're two inches shorter than me and I have more hair"?

entry.title: Diving With a Purpose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Diving With a Purpose, a nonprofit focused on maritime archaeology, helped identify and document the wreck of the 18th-century Portuguese slave ship São José Paquete Africa?

entry.title: the Q (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Q contains a drawing of "a buff Ned Flanders from The Simpsons with protruding nipples"?
